issue.title: [C++] Create Record Batch Builder class as a reusable and efficient way to transpose row-by-row data to columns
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1114](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1114). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
When dealing with IO interfaces that yield one record at a time, a common task will be appending each element to a sequence.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1114?focusedCommentId=16046909) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
A colleague of mine could be able to submit a builder that takes arbitrary rows (that inherit from std::tuple) and incrementally builds the corresponding table / recordbatch. The Schema is then inferred from the class structure at compile time.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1114?focusedCommentId=16215928) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
